22#else
23#define HAVE_MAIN_PORT_DEFAULT 0
24#endif

31
32constexpr CGLRendererProperty kCGLRPRegistryIDLow = static_cast<CGLRendererProperty>(140);
33constexpr CGLRendererProperty kCGLRPRegistryIDHigh = static_cast<CGLRendererProperty>(141);
34
35std::string GetMachineModel()
36{
37#if HAVE_MAIN_PORT_DEFAULT
38 const mach_port_t mainPort = kIOMainPortDefault;
39#else
40#pragma clang diagnostic push
41#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wdeprecated-declarations"
42 const mach_port_t mainPort = kIOMasterPortDefault;
43#pragma clang diagnostic pop
44#endif
45 io_service_t platformExpert = IOServiceGetMatchingService(
46 mainPort, IOServiceMatching("IOPlatformExpertDevice"));
47
48 if (platformExpert == IO_OBJECT_NULL)
49 {
50 return "";
51 }
52
53 CFDataRef modelData = static_cast<CFDataRef>(
54 IORegistryEntryCreateCFProperty(platformExpert, CFSTR("model"), kCFAllocatorDefault, 0));
55 if (modelData == nullptr)
56 {
57 IOObjectRelease(platformExpert);
58 return "";
59 }
60
61 std::string result = reinterpret_cast<const char *>(CFDataGetBytePtr(modelData));
62
63 IOObjectRelease(platformExpert);
64 CFRelease(modelData);
65
66 return result;
67}
68
69// Extracts one integer property from a registry entry.
70bool GetEntryProperty(io_registry_entry_t entry, CFStringRef name, uint32_t *value)
71{
72 *value = 0;
73
74 CFDataRef data = static_cast<CFDataRef>(
75 IORegistryEntrySearchCFProperty(entry, kIOServicePlane, name, kCFAllocatorDefault,
76 kIORegistryIterateRecursively | kIORegistryIterateParents));
77
78 if (data == nullptr)
79 {
80 return false;
81 }
82
83 const uint32_t *valuePtr = reinterpret_cast<const uint32_t *>(CFDataGetBytePtr(data));
84
85 if (valuePtr == nullptr)
86 {
87 CFRelease(data);
88 return false;
89 }
90
91 *value = *valuePtr;
92 CFRelease(data);
93 return true;
94}
95
96// Gathers the vendor and device IDs for GPUs listed in the IORegistry.
97void GetIORegistryDevices(std::vector<GPUDeviceInfo> *devices)
98{
99 constexpr uint32_t kNumServices = 2;
100 const char *kServiceNames[kNumServices] = {"IOPCIDevice", "AGXAccelerator"};
101 const bool kServiceIsVGA[kNumServices] = {true, false};
102 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < kNumServices; ++i)
103 {
104 // matchDictionary will be consumed by IOServiceGetMatchingServices, no need to release it.
105 CFMutableDictionaryRef matchDictionary = IOServiceMatching(kServiceNames[i]);
106
107 io_iterator_t entryIterator;
108#if HAVE_MAIN_PORT_DEFAULT
109 const mach_port_t mainPort = kIOMainPortDefault;
110#else
111#pragma clang diagnostic push
112#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wdeprecated-declarations"
113 const mach_port_t mainPort = kIOMasterPortDefault;
114#pragma clang diagnostic pop
115#endif
116 if (IOServiceGetMatchingServices(mainPort, matchDictionary, &entryIterator) !=
117 kIOReturnSuccess)
118 {
119 continue;
120 }
121
122 io_registry_entry_t entry = IO_OBJECT_NULL;
123 while ((entry = IOIteratorNext(entryIterator)) != IO_OBJECT_NULL)
124 {
125 constexpr uint32_t kClassCodeDisplayVGA = 0x30000;
126 uint32_t classCode;
127 GPUDeviceInfo info;
128
129 // AGXAccelerator entries only provide a vendor ID.
130 if (!GetEntryProperty(entry, CFSTR("vendor-id"), &info.vendorId))
131 {
132 continue;
133 }
134
135 if (kServiceIsVGA[i])
136 {
137 if (!GetEntryProperty(entry, CFSTR("class-code"), &classCode))
138 {
139 continue;
140 }
141 if (classCode != kClassCodeDisplayVGA)
142 {
143 continue;
144 }
145 if (!GetEntryProperty(entry, CFSTR("device-id"), &info.deviceId))
146 {
147 continue;
148 }
149 }
150
151 devices->push_back(info);
152 IOObjectRelease(entry);
153 }
154 IOObjectRelease(entryIterator);
155
156 // If any devices have been populated by IOPCIDevice, do not continue to AGXAccelerator.
157 if (!devices->empty())
158 {
159 break;
160 }
161 }
162}
163
164void SetActiveGPUIndex(SystemInfo *info)
165{
166 VendorID activeVendor = 0;
167 DeviceID activeDevice = 0;
168
169 uint64_t gpuID = GetGpuIDFromDisplayID(kCGDirectMainDisplay);
170
171 if (gpuID == 0)
172 return;
173
174 CFMutableDictionaryRef matchDictionary = IORegistryEntryIDMatching(gpuID);
175#if HAVE_MAIN_PORT_DEFAULT
176 const mach_port_t mainPort = kIOMainPortDefault;
177#else
178#pragma clang diagnostic push
179#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wdeprecated-declarations"
180 const mach_port_t mainPort = kIOMasterPortDefault;
181#pragma clang diagnostic pop
182#endif
183 io_service_t gpuEntry = IOServiceGetMatchingService(mainPort, matchDictionary);
184
185 if (gpuEntry == IO_OBJECT_NULL)
186 {
187 IOObjectRelease(gpuEntry);
188 return;
189 }
190
191 if (!(GetEntryProperty(gpuEntry, CFSTR("vendor-id"), &activeVendor) &&
192 GetEntryProperty(gpuEntry, CFSTR("device-id"), &activeDevice)))
193 {
194 IOObjectRelease(gpuEntry);
195 return;
196 }
197
198 IOObjectRelease(gpuEntry);
199
200 for (size_t i = 0; i < info->gpus.size(); ++i)
201 {
202 if (info->gpus[i].vendorId == activeVendor && info->gpus[i].deviceId == activeDevice)
203 {
204 info->activeGPUIndex = static_cast<int>(i);
205 break;
206 }
207 }
208}
209
210} // anonymous namespace
211
212// Code from WebKit to get the active GPU's ID given a Core Graphics display ID.
213// https://trac.webkit.org/browser/webkit/trunk/Source/WebCore/platform/mac/PlatformScreenMac.mm
214// Used with permission.
215uint64_t GetGpuIDFromDisplayID(uint32_t displayID)
216{
217 return GetGpuIDFromOpenGLDisplayMask(CGDisplayIDToOpenGLDisplayMask(displayID));
218}
219
220// Code from WebKit to query the GPU ID given an OpenGL display mask.
221// https://trac.webkit.org/browser/webkit/trunk/Source/WebCore/platform/mac/PlatformScreenMac.mm
222// Used with permission.
223uint64_t GetGpuIDFromOpenGLDisplayMask(uint32_t displayMask)
224{
225 if (@available(macOS 10.13, *))
226 {
227 GLint numRenderers = 0;
228 CGLRendererInfoObj rendererInfo = nullptr;
229 CGLError error = CGLQueryRendererInfo(displayMask, &rendererInfo, &numRenderers);
230 if (!numRenderers || !rendererInfo || error != kCGLNoError)
231 return 0;
232
233 // The 0th renderer should not be the software renderer.
234 GLint isAccelerated;
235 error = CGLDescribeRenderer(rendererInfo, 0, kCGLRPAccelerated, &isAccelerated);
236 if (!isAccelerated || error != kCGLNoError)
237 {
238 CGLDestroyRendererInfo(rendererInfo);
239 return 0;
240 }
241
242 GLint gpuIDLow = 0;
243 GLint gpuIDHigh = 0;
244
245 error = CGLDescribeRenderer(rendererInfo, 0, kCGLRPRegistryIDLow, &gpuIDLow);
246 if (error != kCGLNoError)
247 {
248 CGLDestroyRendererInfo(rendererInfo);
249 return 0;
250 }
251
252 error = CGLDescribeRenderer(rendererInfo, 0, kCGLRPRegistryIDHigh, &gpuIDHigh);
253 if (error != kCGLNoError)
254 {
255 CGLDestroyRendererInfo(rendererInfo);
256 return 0;
257 }
258
259 CGLDestroyRendererInfo(rendererInfo);
260 return (static_cast<uint64_t>(static_cast<uint32_t>(gpuIDHigh)) << 32) |
261 static_cast<uint64_t>(static_cast<uint32_t>(gpuIDLow));
262 }
263
264 return 0;
265}
266
267// Get VendorID from metal device's registry ID
268VendorID GetVendorIDFromMetalDeviceRegistryID(uint64_t registryID)
269{
270# if defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACOS)
271 // On macOS, the following code is only supported since 10.13.
272 if (@available(macOS 10.13, *))
273# endif
274 {
275 // Get a matching dictionary for the IOGraphicsAccelerator2
276 CFMutableDictionaryRef matchingDict = IORegistryEntryIDMatching(registryID);
277 if (matchingDict == nullptr)
278 {
279 return 0;
280 }
281
282 // IOServiceGetMatchingService will consume the reference on the matching dictionary,
283 // so we don't need to release the dictionary.
284#if HAVE_MAIN_PORT_DEFAULT
285 const mach_port_t mainPort = kIOMainPortDefault;
286#else
287#pragma clang diagnostic push
288#pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wdeprecated-declarations"
289 const mach_port_t mainPort = kIOMasterPortDefault;
290#pragma clang diagnostic pop
291#endif
292 io_registry_entry_t acceleratorEntry =
293 IOServiceGetMatchingService(mainPort, matchingDict);
294 if (acceleratorEntry == IO_OBJECT_NULL)
295 {
296 return 0;
297 }
298
299 // Get the parent entry that will be the IOPCIDevice
300 io_registry_entry_t deviceEntry = IO_OBJECT_NULL;
301 if (IORegistryEntryGetParentEntry(acceleratorEntry, kIOServicePlane, &deviceEntry) !=
302 kIOReturnSuccess ||
303 deviceEntry == IO_OBJECT_NULL)
304 {
305 IOObjectRelease(acceleratorEntry);
306 return 0;
307 }
308
309 IOObjectRelease(acceleratorEntry);
310
311 uint32_t vendorId;
312 if (!GetEntryProperty(deviceEntry, CFSTR("vendor-id"), &vendorId))
313 {
314 vendorId = 0;
315 }
316
317 IOObjectRelease(deviceEntry);
318
319 return vendorId;
320 }
321 return 0;
322}
323
324bool GetSystemInfo_mac(SystemInfo *info)
325{
326 {
327 int32_t major = 0;
328 int32_t minor = 0;
329 ParseMacMachineModel(GetMachineModel(), &info->machineModelName, &major, &minor);
330 info->machineModelVersion = std::to_string(major) + "." + std::to_string(minor);
331 }
332
333 GetIORegistryDevices(&info->gpus);
334 if (info->gpus.empty())
335 {
336 return false;
337 }
338
339 // Call the generic GetDualGPUInfo function to initialize info fields
340 // such as isOptimus, isAMDSwitchable, and the activeGPUIndex
341 GetDualGPUInfo(info);
342
343 // Then override the activeGPUIndex field of info to reflect the current
344 // GPU instead of the non-intel GPU
345 if (@available(macOS 10.13, *))
346 {
347 SetActiveGPUIndex(info);
348 }
349
350 // Figure out whether this is a dual-GPU system.
351 //
352 // TODO(kbr): this code was ported over from Chromium, and its correctness
353 // could be improved - need to use Mac-specific APIs to determine whether
354 // offline renderers are allowed, and whether these two GPUs are really the
355 // integrated/discrete GPUs in a laptop.
356 if (info->gpus.size() == 2 &&
357 ((IsIntel(info->gpus[0].vendorId) && !IsIntel(info->gpus[1].vendorId)) ||
358 (!IsIntel(info->gpus[0].vendorId) && IsIntel(info->gpus[1].vendorId))))
359 {
360 info->isMacSwitchable = true;
361 }
362
363#if defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACCATALYST) && defined(ANGLE_CPU_ARM64)
364 info->needsEAGLOnMac = true;
365#endif
366
367 return true;
368}
369
370} // namespace angle

372#endif // defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACOS) || defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACCATALYST)
